description: Apply the "Stirling-Bernoulli transform" to A000081 = (1,1,1,2,4,9,20,...), rooted trees.
comments: The "Stirling-Bernoulli transform" maps a sequence b_0, b_1, b_2, ... to a sequence c_0, c_1, c_2, ..., where if B has o.g.f. B(x), c has e.g.f. exp(x)*B(1-exp(x)).
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
maple: with(numtheory): with(combinat):b:= proc(n) option remember; local d, j; `if` (n<3, 1,      (add(add(d*b(d), d=divisors(j))*b(n-j), j=1..n-1))/(n-1))    end:a:= n-> add((-1)^k *k! *stirling2(n+1, k+1)*b(k), k=0..n):seq(a(n), n=0..20);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, May 17 2013
mathematica: b[n_] := b[n] = Module[{d, j}, If[n < 3, 1, Sum[Sum[d*b[d], {d, Divisors[j]}]*b[n-j], {j, 1, n-1}]/(n-1)]]; a[n_] := Sum[(-1)^k*k!*StirlingS2[n+1, k+1]*b[k], {k, 0, n}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 20}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Jul 01 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 09 1999
